title: Plane crash causes multiple casualties at British AirshowTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Plane crash causes multiple casualties at British Airshow
An airshow in Brighton turned deadly when a plane crashed and caused several casualties. The incident occurred on Englandâ€™s south coast at around 1:20 p.m. local time (8:20 a.m. ET)., emergency services said Saturday.
According to media reports, the plane was a Hawker Hunter fighter jet, a type that dates from the 1950s.
Several cars on a main road, the A27, to the north of Shoreham airport, where the Shoreham Air Show is taking place were hit by the aircraft.
Sussex Police said in a statement confirmed that there have been several casualties in the incident.
